doc.field: Water Mill at Gennep is the subject and title of three oil paintings created in 1884 by Vincent van Gogh. Van Gogh painted Water Mill at Gennep (F125) in November, 1884. He wrote to his brother, Theo: "Yesterday I brought home that study of the water mill at Gennep, which I painted with pleasure, and which has procured me a new friend in Eindhoven [Anton Kerssemakers], who passionately wants to learn to paint, and to whom I paid a visit, after which we set to work at once. " F46-Raderen-Genneper-watermolen. jpg Water Mill at Gennep, 1884, Noordbrabants Museum, 's-Hertogenbosch, Netherlands - on loan from the Netherlands Office for Fine Arts (F46) F47-Watermolen-te-Gennep. jpg Water Mill at Gennep, 1884, private collection (F47) - black and white reproduction Vincent van Gogh - Watermolen in Gennep. jpg Water Mill at Gennep, 1884, Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza, Madrid, Spain (F125) Van Gogh also made a watercolor of the Water Mill at Gennep (F1144a) in mid-November, 1884.

Water Mill at Gennep is the subject and title of three oil paintings created in 1884 by Vincent van Gogh. Van Gogh painted Water Mill at Gennep (F125) in November, 1884. He wrote to his brother, Theo: "Yesterday I brought home that study of the water mill at Gennep, which I painted with pleasure, and which has procured me a new friend in Eindhoven [Anton Kerssemakers], who passionately wants to learn to paint, and to whom I paid a visit, after which we set to work at once.
